title: FTX Hires Ex-Regulators to Investigate Firm's Collapse
description: The crypto exchange tapped former SEC and CFTC enforcement chiefs to help figure out what went wrong and to communicate with regulators.

title: Hackers Temporarily Take Down European Parliament Website
description: Attack came hours after EU lawmakers passed a resolution calling Russia a state sponsor of terrorism.

title: The Sinister Logic of Hidden Online Fees
description: Customers can’t resist a low price upfront, even when they know more charges will be tacked on at the register.

title: Judge in Elizabeth Holmes Case Proposes Texas Prison Camp for Theranos Founder
description: U.S. District Judge Edward Davila, who oversaw the trial and sentenced her on Friday, ordered Ms. Holmes to surrender to the facility in April.

title: Adobe Challenger Bets Economic Downturn Will Propel Sales
description: Design-software startup Canva is attempting to convince businesses that its products offer better value.

title: Videogame Companies Brace for Lackluster Holiday Season
description: The industry could post its first annual sales decline in at least a decade.

title: Musk's Twitter Takeover Triggers a Partisan Clash
description: Democrats say company staff cutbacks are threatening user security, while Republicans maintain that the dispute is over free speech.

title: IPhone Factory Workers Clash With Police at Covid-Hit Plant in China
description: Workers at the plant said protests started around an accommodation area for employees after they learned bonus payments they expected to get would be delayed.
